metadata.title: CVE-2020-20448 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
FFmpeg 4.1.3 is affected by a Divide By Zero issue vialibavcodec/ratecontrol.c, which allows a remote malicious user to cause aDenial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 4.2
libavcodec-extra - 4.2
libavcodec-extra58 - 4.2
libavcodec58 - 4.2
libavdevice58 - 4.2
libavfilter-extra - 4.2
libavfilter-extra7 - 4.2
libavfilter7 - 4.2
libavformat58 - 4.2
libavresample4 - 4.2
libavutil56 - 4.2
libpostproc55 - 4.2
libswresample3 - 4.2
libswscale5 - 4.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2').
